question.text:
In 1840s, in New York, rich establishments hired private gangs to guard their property.

There were two main rival gangs: Metropolitans and Municipals.

Municipals distinguished themselves from Metropolitans by wearing shiny copper badges.

What term, widely used today, do we call Municipals now?

answer.text: Cops. Badges were made of copper.
answer.desc:
Private security gangs developed into Police Officers.
Rival gang of Metropolitans called Municipals «cops» (short from «copper» because they wore copper badges) this is how the name for Police Officers came about.

question.text: Sir Francis Bacon, Alexander von Humboldt, and Benjamin Franklin all tried to play a children's game with map of the world. That led to one of the greatest scientific theories of the 20th century. The question is: name that children's game.

answer.desc: Look at the coast of Western Africa and the coast of Eastern South America. Do you see that it looks like they can come together? Also look at Australia and at Eastern Africa. Thus theory of Plate Tectonics was born, which stated that Earth once was one solid continent called Pangea.

question.text:
M-Prize is a prize awarded to the scientist who can extend the life of a lab mouse the most.

Stefan Spindler won M-Prize with a regular mouse which did was not generically or physiologically altered, did not take any medication and lived just a regular life. The only difference between that mouse and all other mice was the fact that it did same thing as 45% of people in United States.

Question: what did a lab mouse which lived the longest do which other mice did not?

answer.desc: Calorie Restriction - so far the only proven method of life extension. Calorie Restriction increases life span 20-40%.

question.text:

Question: What should my average speed for the second lap be, so total average speed for two laps would equal 10 mph.

answer.desc:
Why not 15? Let’s assume lap is 5 miles. Then first lap I ran for 1 hour (5 mph / 5 miles). If I ran for 15 mph then I would make 3 laps! But problem states only 2 total.

Then two laps together I also need to run 1 hour: (10 mph / 10 miles) two laps, 5 miles each.

If I already run the first lap at 1 hour and I need to run both laps at 1 hour according to the problem, then I need to run second lap instantly.

1st one included scrap metal, furniture, broken kitchenware — everything that cannot be grinded.

2nd one included everything which can be processed, mainly the compost.

Question: Name those 2 terms, which each of you uses extensively.

answer.desc: Hardware — scrap metal, furniture, broken kitchenware. Software — everything which can be processed, mainly the compost.
